name: Introduction to Machine Learning
description: An introduction to methods for automated learning of relationships on the basis of empirical data. Classification and regression using nearest neighbour methods, decision trees, linear models, and neural networks. Clustering algorithms. Problems of overfitting and of assessing accuracy. Basics of reinforcement learning.
prerequisites: CSC207H1, MAT235Y1/MAT237Y1/MAT257Y1/(minimum of 77% in MAT135H1 and MAT136H1)/(minimum of 73% in MAT137Y1)/(minimum of 67% in MAT157Y1), MAT221H1/MAT223H1/MAT240H1, STA247H1/STA255H1/STA257H1
exclusions: CSC411H1, STA314H1, ECE421H1. NOTE: Students not enrolled in the Computer Science Major or Specialist program at the UTSG, UTM, or UTSC are limited to a maximum of three 300-/400-level CSC/ECE half-courses.
